cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 10 miles WSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast along the U.S. Mid-Atlantic coast toward southeastern New England and then Nova Scotia

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect for parts of Nova Scotia (well north of Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Surf City NC to NC/VA border; Tropical Storm Warning northward to Delaware and Massachusetts
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coastline from North Carolina to New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: None – cyclone already well north-east of Florida by 2019-09-06
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed (no Florida Gulf location in probability table)
weather_observation.wind: None — tropical-storm-force winds remain over the Atlantic side of Florida and northward along the East Coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: None — no surge threat on the Gulf coast side of Florida from Dorian
weather_observation.rainfall: None — only indirect outer-band showers possible, not heavy
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large Atlantic swells and rip currents possible on Florida’s Atlantic beaches, but no operational impacts expected on the Gulf-side Manatee County Port
